Reviews.Title: “Beware of bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Bibi R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and had a really good time in Barcelona. The hostel is close to the Ramblas, metro, sites, supermarket and different type of eats. The free walking tour is a huge plus!...you just tip the tour guide. Ok...so, the first and second night was ok...it wasn't until the 3rd day when i awoke to water dripping on my bed! We contacted the receptionist, but had to sit out of my room for 3 hours only to be told that the room is being fixed and I will have to move to another room and will have to wait till someone checks out. no problem, but I didn't want to spend my last day in barcelona in the waiting area till someone checked out. when i went back to the room to move my stuff out, the smell from the water was absolutely disgusting! i had to hold my breath!...I believe it was from the toilet above! now...at this point, some of my clothes got wet. After moving my things to the next room, I had to go to the laundrymat to wash the clothes, which took more time in my day! I complained to the receptionist and was told that she will speak to the manager. later that day, i was compensated only 10 euros for my laundry. they did not offer to reimburse me to at least one night! so, here's the worst part!...i went to bed that night and couldn't sleep....i felt this crawling sensation and was itching half the night!...when i woke up...I had a few welts on my arms!...yes!!!...BED BUGS! at this point...i wanted to just get out of there! i didn't even complain because they didn't even do anything about the water issue. the only reason i give this an average is because of the location and free walking tour, but in terms of the room...i give this place a very poor service!

Reviews.Title: “Good, small hostel in the centre”
Reviews.Author: Sanders394
Reviews.Content: We stayed her with 3 girls for 4 nights, and we had a really nice time. The hostel is very small, so we didn't really see other people who stayed in the hostel. It's clean and the bathroom was quite big with a good shower and bath (we had a private bathroom ensuite). The hostel is really close to the Rambla with many restaurants, so it's right in the centre. I can really recommend the pub crawl, it was a lot of fun. The breakfast was really basic, only coffee, tea and bread with ham and cheese, but it was free. There are 2 computers downstairs with free internet. The rooms were quite small, but I think that is not a problem, as Barcelona is not a city to stay in your hostel all day. Towels and linen were also included, we got new towels every day. I can really recommend this hostel for friends who are staying in Barca for a few days, but when you are alone and you want to meet other people, this hostel is not the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be late!”
Reviews.Author: LS173
Reviews.Content: Positives Points: the free wifi, breakfast and the location, it is located about 4 blocks from "Las Ramblas", but their street is not safe (an advice: do not be late!). Negatives points: The rooms are very small, I mean, even if you’re by yourself it can be difficult to move around the room and the heating don't work very well (the room is cold). The atmosphere in general is not good; the staff don’t speak English very well and not helpfull. They charge to print boarding passes and use the locker etc. The money valor is not the best at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BrokeAussies
Reviews.Content: Rooms fine, well appointed, but walls in this hostel are paper thin. Combined with the noise from the lively lane aside the hostel this is not the place for a quite stay. but if you want to party on, crash and do it all again..it's the place for you. NO real common areas but who cares in this location you would be out anyway. Laneway at side of hostel is quite dodgy, but security in hotel is 100%. Staff friendly, and hostel very clean.

Reviews.Title: “With some improvements could be an excellent Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Carina8782
Reviews.Content: Be Ramblas is definitly a Hostel and not a Hotel. Being a Hostel is a good one comparing to some horrible hostels that you can find around Europe. LOCATION On the Hostel's street you can find mini supermarkets, ATMs, cheap souvenir shops, bars and the beautiful Palau Güell from Gaudí. The Hostel is well situated, literally less than 5 minutes walking to the famous Las Ramblas. From there you can easily go to Plaça Reial, Plaça de Catalunya, La Boqueria, Barri Gótic, Port Vell, Avinguda del Paral·lel, Rambla del Raval, etc. At night the street can be busy and loud because of the pubs but the Hostel's windows are double glass, so you can get a good night of sleep. There's excellent access to public transports: metro, buses, taxis. BEDROOMS The bedroom ensuite is small but doable. All bedrooms have balcony with excellent natural light, flat TV, air conditioning, free internet, linen and towels. The room was clean everyday. Towels and linen changed everyday too. Anyway, the towels and linen were not so clean because everyday we found some stains in it and little hairs in the sheets. We were really concerned about it. The bathroom has everything we needed and has a good shower. In our last day there, unfortunately, we found 3 small cockroaches running around the room, I don't know if we let the window open or if they were there before...anyways, is always disgusting! BREAKFAST Some people here liked the breakfast, some people don't. We didn't like in regards to the quantity and variety of it. Everyday we went for the breakfast room at 9.30am and almost everything were gone...almost nothing to eat and no variety. I am not asking for a fancy breakfast because I know that is a Hostel but 1 or 2 things can be added in it. The breakfast was not enough to achieve the classic expression 'good to go'...we had to stop in some places to eat something more to be able to start our long walks around the city. LOCKERS Be Ramblas has lockers where you can put your luggage after you do the check out. Our flight home was only at 6pm, so we put our luggage there - for 2€ - and we went for our final walk in Barcelona. Once you put your luggage there you cannot open the locker again unless you want to pay another 2€. So, be sure you put everything you want in there until you open it to grab your belongings and go. STAFF Staff is polite and helpful. We had a little problem with the TV, we went to the reception and they quickly fixed the problem. The moment you arrive to do the check-in, a staff member of the reception will charge you the room. Be ready to pay in cash! Some more info: - The elevator starts on the first floor, so you have to go up the stairs with your luggage. - Every time you leave the hostel you have to give your room key in the reception. - A bit expensive for a Hostel but perfectly located to explore the city. Maybe in that area there are better hostels with better prices and conditions. Is a matter of looking for those hostels and compare them. But I have to say, even with those flaws I mencioned, Be Ramblas is not an awful hostel...is just doable. With some improvements I am sure that it will be like an average Hotel and not just a Hostel. By the way, you must go to Méson David to have dinner. The restaurant is from the Be Hostels Group. We went there and it was a great spanish experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good hostel, not great assistance”
Reviews.Author: LovinItAce
Reviews.Content: Room was great, small but doable. Sink in room was very helpful. Breaky was good. Great easy location. Staff help was interesting. Advertised tapas tours with wrong meeting point and still posters up when we left, so we missed out, luckily there 2 more nights! also not your usual overly helpful tips that u get at a hostel about sites etc. Walking tour didn't arrive and taff not particularly helpful. Nice enough though. Travel bar has otter tours so just make sure to look around and not take their only ones as guy wouldn't suggest others to us which is wrong I think. Good actual hostel though

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Brendanandmerrisa
Reviews.Content: This hostel is in a great location near the La Rambla and only a short stroll from many attractions and the Metro for more further afield sightseeing. Our room was clean and well presented. Breakfast was included and was sufficient to fuel you for a day of exploring the city. Our only gripe was that there was a surcharge of 8% on the bill if you paid by card (either debit or credit). This wasn't mentioned on the website anywhere. Since we had come straight from the airport with our luggage, going looking for a cash machine wasn't an option, so we were charged the 8%. The wireless Internet also went out for the last 2 days of our stay, which was inconvenient as we needed to book accommodation for the next leg of our journey. Otherwise, our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PeachLAmour
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely place to stay. Booked it on a Hostel site so expected it to be just a bog-standard room, I was pleasantly surprised. Clean towels and bedding every day. Room and shared bathroom cleaned every day. Breakfasts where a basic "DIY" job, provided with bread, cheese, jam in the mornings. Pretty strict with when they cleaned it all up, but always managed to make it despite my love for a lie in. Location was not as close to Las Ramblas as expected, a little way up a side street, but very close indeed. Loved the Gothic Quarter most of all. And Gaudi's Palace created for Guell should be open now... it is on the same street as this place! Walls were a little on the thin side, but we weren't really in the room in the evening anyway so it wasn't a big issue. The free walking tours are a must do, really gives you your bearings! Overall a really great place to stay to explore this beautiful city on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nearest think a hostel can be to a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Snoop66
Reviews.Content: Lovely high end hostel. Pros: Great and safe location. Clean and modern rooms. Free breakfast and internet. Quiet location. Cons: Expense for a hostel but still a lot cheaper than a city center hotel! Staff took the room key off us every time we left which seemed strange to me. We had to pay for all our nights up front in cash which is a bit of a nuisance. Overall a perfact hostel if you want a quiet central base to explore the city but my be a bit quiet and expensive if your looking to have a lads weekend kind of trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, old but fresh”
Reviews.Author: Zeppelin0
Reviews.Content: We've rented a double bed private room. It was like in a small hotel. The only reason why not to choose this hostle would be its noisy surroundings. There are not many computers to be used but the stuff is quite friendly and it can be managed. Next time in Barcelona I (or we) may decide to choose the same hostel again.

Reviews.Title: “definitely one of the best budget hostel”
Reviews.Author: Courla
Reviews.Content: so the area is dodgy cuz of the hookers just around the corner, and it gets a little worse one block north of the hotel. but it's also very central if you want to see the old barcelona, and apart from the few unpleasant streets i mentioned, the area is awesome. 5 minutes walk from anything, you name it. the service is absolutely lame - the receptionist for instance wants 100% of the entire stay upfront, and he won't even accept to take several cards for the payment (which normally comes in handy if you have made a 4 nights booking for 7 friends, but no not here) breakfast is ok when you come back after a long night out and you're just starving, but otherwise it's plain tasteless hostel food apart from that, the rate is low and the rooms are nice, clean, and pretty quiet for a hostel. shared bathroom which is modern and clean and surprisingly almost always free.... overall really good value and i know what i'm talking about, I have stayed in dozens of these cheap hostels in barcelona and this one was the best

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KalinaMalina
Reviews.Content: To me this hostel is notable for its cleanliness mostly - I can basically not care about anything else in hostels but how clean they are. My boyfriend and I were quite comfortable in this one - had a separate double room, shared a bathroom but never had to wait to use it plus there was a sink in our room. The shared bathroom and our room were cleaned daily quite well, toilet paper and soap were constantly refilled. The linen and the towels we got were clean and changed daily. The room was really very small, you can hardly fit 2 big suitcases in the tiny pathway between the door and the bed but we only got there to sleep so that was fine for us. Breakfast could have been better for the price we paid but was ok-ish - cereal, bread, ham & cheese. We found the staff friendly, but didn't have to ask too much of them anyway. The hostel is less than 5 min walk from La Rambla, 10 min walk to the sea, close to several stations of different metro lines. It was perfect for what we needed, so we would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “never again!”
Reviews.Author: qsinka
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hostal 2 nights and were really disappointed with the stay from the very beginning. As we arrived it came out that we have got a single room instead of a double one (which we booked). The manager has agreed to change the rooms but for a double price!!!! it was obviously cheating so we have left. Watch out!

Reviews.Title: “Ok location, apathetic staff.”
Reviews.Author: JennaRN
Reviews.Content: Decently close to las Ramblas, pretty clean and a bit expensive (but so is Barcelona in general.) There isn't any good common areas if you are hoping to meet people. I was decently satisfied with our stay until the last morning when we were heading out to catch our international flight. I had told the front desk guy to call us in the morning at a specific time and watched him write it down. Luckily I woke up on my own the next morning and we packed up. When I asked the guy at the front dest what happened to our wake up call he just gave me a blank look (I said it in Spanish to be sure he understood me). Then he saw the post-it note, held it up and shrugged. He didn't even apologize. I was not impressed with the staff at all- we could have missed our flight and they didn't even care!

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: t_w_s_d
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed at the location of this hotel/hostel because the webpage made it sound like it was on La Rambla, but in reality it is quite a ways down a side street. It was a long ways to haul our bags. The staff were helpful and spoke some English. Our room was spacious and comfortable, and we appreciated having a sink in the room since we did not buy a room with a bathroom. The communal bathroom was close by and clean. The lock on the doors of both the room and the bathroom were good and solid as well. The street below was very very loud at night, but the hotel can't help this. All in all I was pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hostel”
Reviews.Author: atusatus1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hostel for 2 nights in Feb and it was great. Really close to everything! The hostel is located on a side street just of las ramblas so could get to everywhere by walking, it is also real close to the metro and main square. Staff were friendly and hostel very clean!! Bargain price, would deffo recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hostel”
Reviews.Author: JoP_qui_aime_voyager
Reviews.Content: This hostel was amazing for its cleaness. the staff was really helpful. I loved staying at this hostel. The room was tiny but affordable and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: toto0713
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located to a very far end of Nou Ramblas and its really a long walk to the main ramblas area. By the time we arrived to the hotel the place appears as really more of a hostal type and not a hotel as stated on there website. The day duty hotel assistant doesnt look accomodating and appears not interested to us. As we took the key for our booking they allocated us to the 5th floor and the room appears very small like a dog house very bad in appearance. My wife and I wasnt satisfy at all that we need to fit in ourselves to a bed that would accomodate only for a single person. Apart from that the breakfast is the worst one not even hot water is available but you need to use to microwave to make hot drinks next time I wouldnt take a word from them . But we tried to make things work as we want to enjoy our stay in Barcelona to explore the best places and highly recommended the Monserrat a breathtaking experience of a life time will be back soon but not coming to this hostal . I wouldnt recommend this place to anybody as it will ruin your holiday. I might suggest Hostal Layetana nice place and fantastic location cheaper than the Barcelona Ramblas Hostal.
